item.title: Rubbish dumped, 30th October
item.description:
Black bags dumped on the pavement with rubbish spilling out and blocking access to the pavement. Makes it difficult for pushchairs, wheelchairs, those that use walking aids. Dumped overnight.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookdene Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Furniture dumped on Dewar Street, 30th October
item.description:
A mattress and bed have been dumped on dewar street. This keeps happening. We’re very frustrated by it. I reported this earlier and it was marked ‘fixed’ when it clearly isn’t, as the bed and frame are still there. Please stop doing this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dewar Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The Mews, Postcode DA14 4BH has no lighting at all, 30th October
item.description:
Hello. I have recently moved into my flat at No 4, The Mews, Hatherley Road DA14 4BH. There are a number of residential properties within this tight space. But it receives no public lighting at all? Has this never been raised? There are families with young children in residence. I attach some shots taken at night and during the day. Surely there must be a solution for this as most certainly represents a space that would invite ASB. Please do feel free to get in touch. I would be shocked if the other residents and local retailers/businesses have never raised this. There is a Nail-Bar directly opposite, which must have some concerns regarding the lighting availability at this location. Please do come and investigate. Happy to speak with Lighting Officer/Technician. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Motorist driving up one-way system outside Hillman Street causing hazard and danger to pedestrians and cyclists. Please address this dangerous issue outside Hackney Council building. Enforcement requireddriving up a one-way street, you'll likely receive a fine and points on your license, typically a £100 fine and three points, but it could be considered careless driving. In more serious cases, you could face a court summons, a higher fine (up to £5,000), more penalty points (up to nine), a driving ban, or even disqualification. The exact penalty depends on factors like the presence of other road users, the driver's record, and the specific circumstances. ., 30th October
item.description:
Driving up a one-way street, you'll likely receive a fine and points on your license, typically a £100 fine and three points, but it could be considered careless driving. In more serious cases, you could face a court summons, a higher fine (up to £5,000),

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Florfield Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
